variant.name: .SetupService.PullAndApplyPolicies

variant.name: .SetupService.Total

histogram.name: Arc.AbiMigration.BootTime
histogram.summary: Time taken for ARC to boot during an Abi Migration event. Warning: this histogram was expired from 08/04/2022 to 07/12/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.AbiMigration.DowngradeDelay
Arc.AbiMigration.Event
histogram.summary: Records event type for ArcAbiMigrationService during Abi Migration. Warning: this histogram was expired from 08/04/2022 to 07/12/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.AbiMigration.FailedAttempts
histogram.summary: Records the number of failed attempts in trying to perform Primary Abi Migration. Warning: this histogram was expired from 08/04/2022 to 07/12/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.Accessibility.ActiveTime.{ArcAccessibilityFeatures}
histogram.summary: For each window, measure the time that the window is focused with {ArcAccessibilityFeatures} enabled. This metric is recorded when the window loses focus or the window is closed.

histogram.name: Arc.Accessibility.WindowCount
histogram.summary: Count the number of windows with accessibility features enabled when a window is opened or an accessibility feature is enabled while windows exist.

histogram.name: Arc.AdbSideloadingEnablingScreen
histogram.summary:
Record user's choice or error during ADB sideloading opt-in UI after reboot.
This histogram was expired between 2022-05-01 and 2023-09-07. Data might be missing or incomplete for this period.

histogram.name: Arc.AndroidBootTime
histogram.summary:
The time elapsed for booting up the ARC instance.
This metric is capped at 60 seconds, see Arc.UiAvailable if you need a metric that tracks longer.

histogram.name: Arc.Anr.{AnrPeriod}
histogram.summary: ANR rate separated by {AnrPeriod} as ANR count happened in this period.

histogram.name: Arc.Anr.{AnrPeriod}.{ArcBootType}
histogram.summary: ANR rate separated by {AnrPeriod} and {ArcBootType} as ANR count happened in this period.

histogram.name: Arc.Anr.{AnrSource}
histogram.summary: Counts ANR events in the system separated by ANR type and {AnrSource}.

histogram.name: Arc.App.GmsCoreKill.{ArcBootType}
histogram.summary: Counts the types of app kills caused by GMS core updates {ArcBootType}. See go/gmscore-killed-my-app. Emitted when the GMS core update is done.

histogram.name: Arc.App.LowMemoryKills.{ArcAppKillType}Count10Minutes
histogram.summary: Number of ARC Apps killed by {ArcAppKillType} in each interval of 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Arc.App.LowMemoryKills.{ArcBackgroundVms}.{ArcAppKillType}Count10Minutes
histogram.summary: Number of ARC Apps killed by {ArcAppKillType} in each interval of 10 minutes when {ArcBackgroundVms}.

histogram.name: Arc.App.LowMemoryKills{ArcAppKillDailyBackgroundVms}{ArcAppKillDailyType}
histogram.summary: Number of ARC Apps killed each day {ArcAppKillDailyType}. {ArcAppKillDailyBackgroundVms}.

histogram.name: Arc.App.PrimaryAbi
histogram.summary: Emitted for each app launched with ArcAppLauncher. Records the primary ABI used for the app. This will let us know if 32-bit binaries are still being used or if 32-bit support is not needed anymore.

histogram.name: Arc.AppCount
histogram.summary: The number of ARC apps open at any given time. Collected every 5 minutes. This indicates both how many users are engaging with apps and, when they do engage, how many apps they are engaging with at a time.

histogram.name: Arc.AppCount.HasInstalledOrUnknownApp
histogram.summary: True if the user (or Chrome app sync) has manually installed one or more apps. See Arc.AppCount.InstalledApp for more details. UnknownApp is deprecated and has never been collected. Collected once every time when ARC starts.

histogram.name: Arc.AppCount.{AppType}
histogram.summary: The number of Ash Chrome managed ARC {AppType} Collected once every time when ARC starts.

variant.name: DefaultApp
variant.summary: default apps. Either PAI or one in system/vendor image. Can be 1+ even for opt-out users.

variant.name: InstalledApp
variant.summary: apps which the user has manually installed. This includes the one installed via Chrome app sync. 0 for opt-out users.

variant.name: StickyApp
variant.summary: sticky apps in a system/vendor image. This is always 0 for opt-out users.

histogram.name: Arc.AppInstall.CacheHit
histogram.summary: Records whether APK Cache had a hit or miss for an app install request. This metric is recorded when app is being installed for an affiliated managed user.

histogram.name: Arc.AppInstall.PolicySuccessRate
histogram.summary: Record the success rate for all apps within a single policy. This will allow us to understand the reliability of force installs for a single customer. The metric is emitted when success/failure results are received for all apps in a policy or when 30 minutes have elapsed since the policy was received.

histogram.name: Arc.AppInstall.{ArcAppInstallTypes}.InitialSession.NumAppsIncomplete
histogram.summary: Record the number of {ArcAppInstallTypes} that did not complete after the very first login on a device. This metric is recorded when the ARC session is stopped IFF it is the first session after opting in during the sync consent screen.

histogram.name: Arc.AppInstall.{ArcAppInstallTypes}.InitialSession.NumAppsRequested
histogram.summary: Record the number of {ArcAppInstallTypes} that were requested after the very first login on a device. This metric is recorded when the ARC session is stopped IFF it is the first session after opting in during the sync consent screen.

histogram.name: Arc.AppInstall.{ArcAppInstallTypes}.InitialSession.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: Record the length of time it took to complete installation for one {ArcAppInstallTypes} after the very first login on a device. This metric is recorded when the install succeeds IFF it is the first session after opting in during the sync consent screen.

histogram.name: Arc.AppInstalledReason
histogram.summary: Record a reason when an arc application completes installation successfully, including policy based applications, default applications and user prompted installations. Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/01/2021 to 10/01/2021; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.AppLanguageSwitch.{SettingsPage}.TargetLanguage
histogram.summary: Record the settings page source when users change app language, and which language users changed the language to.

histogram.name: Arc.AppRequestedInSession
histogram.summary:
Number of requests of ARC app launching in a user session.
Note: this is emitted at the beginning of the next user session. This is because ash-chrome may be shutdown unexepctedly (incl. crashes), so emit the value at the end of the user session is not reliable enough. Instead, the number of requests are tracked and stored in the PrefService to survive chrome restart, and the value is emitted in the next user session.

histogram.name: Arc.AppShortcutSearchResult.ShortcutStatus
histogram.summary: Emitted for each ARC app shortcut search result. Records whether the icon is empty. This will let us know how often the Google Play Store icon is shown in place of a shortcut.

histogram.name: Arc.AppShortcutsRequest.ShortcutStatus
histogram.summary: Emitted for each requested ARC app shortcut. Records whether the icon is empty. This will let us know how often the Google Play Store icon is shown in place of a shortcut.

histogram.name: Arc.AppsInstalledAtStartup
histogram.summary:
Total number of ARC apps installed on a device measured at startup. Note: This includes launchable apps that are installed by default, such as Play Store and Settings, as well as any vendor specific apps.
Warning: this histogram was expired after M92 and brought back 2021-09-17; expired after M99 and brought back 2022-12-07, then expired after M114 and brought back 2023-07-11; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.AppSync.InitialSession.InstalledAppSize
histogram.summary: Records the app size of apps installed during the initial session of app sync. Metrics are emitted when an app sync install is completed IFF it is the first session after opting in during the sync consent screen.

histogram.name: Arc.AppSync.InitialSession.Latency
histogram.summary: Records the time from the start of app sync until the last finished installation before the session ended. This is not the latency for total app sync, since total app sync may occur over multiple sessions. Metrics are emitted when a user logs off IFF it is the first session after opting in during the sync consent screen.

histogram.name: Arc.AppSync.InitialSession.NumApps{ArcSyncAppTypes}
histogram.summary: Records the count of {ArcSyncAppTypes} apps during the initial session for app sync. Metrics are emitted when a user logs off IFF it is the first session after opting in during the sync consent screen.

histogram.name: Arc.AppUninstallReason
histogram.summary: Record a reason why an application was uninstalled when uninstall is completed. Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/01/2021 to 10/01/2021 and from 2023-06-04 to 2023-08-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.ArcOnDemand.ActivationIsDelayed
histogram.summary: Records whether ARC activation is delayed by ARC on Demand or not. Recorded on a regular boot.

histogram.name: Arc.ArcOnDemandV2.ActivationShouldBeDelayed
histogram.summary: Recorded during every regular boot, regardless of feature flag. Returns whether the ArcOnDemandV2 triggering condition is met (ARC should be activated later in an on-demand manner). This is different from ActivationIsDelayed as this focuses on the triggering conditions without taking into acccount the feature flag.

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.AccountCheck.Status{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: The status of account check before GMS Sign-in. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.AccountCheck.TimeDelta{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for the account status check to be completed. This is not recorded in case of account status check failure. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.Checkin.Attempts{ArcUserTypes}
Arc.Auth.Checkin.TimeDelta{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for the check-in task to be completed. This is recorded in case check-in task is completed successfully. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.MainAccountHashMigration.Status
histogram.summary: Contains the status of the main account hash migration resolution. We record this metric when migrating the main account hash from java hashcode to use a cryptographic hash. This is done at the bootup time.

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.MainAccountResolution.Status{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: Contains the status of main account resolution. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.NetworkWait.TimeDelta{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for network connection before starting other authorization operations. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.NumAccounts
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of accounts in ARC. This is recorded only once per session, at login time.

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.PercentAccounts
histogram.summary: Tracks the percentage of the accounts in session that are also available in ARC. This is recorded only once per session, at login time.

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.Reauth.Reason{ArcUserTypes}
Arc.Auth.RequestAccountInfoResult.Primary
histogram.summary: Contains the status of the account info and auth code fetch for primary account. Recorded when ARC requests account information (e.g. when account is added, when token is updated).

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.RequestAccountInfoResult.Secondary
histogram.summary: Contains the status of the account info and auth code fetch for secondary account. Recorded when ARC requests account information (e.g. when account is added, when token is updated).

histogram.name: Arc.Auth.SignIn.TimeDelta{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for GMS sign-in to complete. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.CloudDpc{TimedCloudDpcOp}.TimeDelta{SuccessFailure}{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to complete the {TimedCloudDpcOp} ({SuccessFailure}) operation in CloudDPC. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.CompanionLibraryApisCounter
histogram.summary: Records the number of times ChromeOS Companion Library API called. Counter adding when its Stub library receive the call from applications.

histogram.name: Arc.CompatMode.InitialResizeLockState
histogram.summary: The initial resize lock state of ARC apps. The histogram is emitted when any ARC window is initialized.

histogram.name: Arc.ContainerLifetimeEvent
histogram.summary:
The number of ARC container lifetime events. One START event and up to one non-START event are recorded per ARC session, which ends when the user opts out from ARC or signs out.
Warning: this histogram was expired after 2022-04-03 and brought back 2022-12-07; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.ContainerRestartAfterCrashCount
histogram.summary:
The number of times ARC container crashes and automatically restarts in one ARC session, which ends when the user opts out from ARC or signs out.
Warning: this histogram was expired after 2022-04-24 and brought back 2022-12-07; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.CpuRestrictionDisabled{ArcThrottleObservers}
histogram.summary: Records the time that throttling was disabled due to a particular throttle observer. The duration begins when a new throttle observer becomes active, and measures until it becomes inactive or another throttle observer becomes effective. {ArcThrottleObservers}

variant.name: .ArcPipWindowIsVisible
variant.summary: An ARC PIP window is active.

variant.name: .ArcSwitch
variant.summary: ARC throttling is disabled by switch. Not expected in production.

histogram.name: Arc.CpuRestrictionVmResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of setting ARC CPU restrictions in ARCVM.

histogram.name: Arc.CumulativeUseTime
histogram.summary:
ARC use time. The use time is incremented in regular intervals while android container is active. Reported at most once a day, at which point accumulated time is reset (which means that sum of reported times for a OS version would give an estimate of ARC usage time per OS version).
Warning: this histogram was expired after 2021-03-12 and brought back 2021-09-17; expired 2022-05-01 and brought back 2022-12-07; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.Data.AppCategory.{Target}.DataSize
histogram.summary: The combined application data size for apps in the {Target}. The data size (StorageStats.dataBytes) is calculated with StorageStatsManager#queryStatsForPackage and reported for every ARC boot.

histogram.name: Arc.Data.Dir.{Target}.Size
histogram.summary: The size of the {Target}. The size of the root /data directory is reported on every ARC boot, but reported only if virtio-blk is enabled for /data. The sizes of other directories are reported regardless of virtio-blk, but reported only once every 30 days for each user to save calculation cost.

histogram.name: Arc.DataRemoved.Success
histogram.summary: True if data was successfully removed on request.

histogram.name: Arc.DataRestore.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration of the SELinux data restoration flow. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-09 to 2023-08-30; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.DataRestore.Status
histogram.summary: Tracks status of SELinux contexts restore flows of Android /data. This also means ARC++ boot delay.

histogram.name: Arc.DeferActivation.Category
histogram.summary: Records how "deferring ARC activation until user session start up task completion" worked.

histogram.name: Arc.DeferActivation.Result
histogram.summary: Records whether the decision of "deferring ARC activation until user session start up task completion", which is prediction, was succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Arc.DeferActivation.{DeferArcActivationType}{SuccessFailure}.ElapsedTime
histogram.summary: How long does it take since the activation necessity check until the following activation for each group of deferring ARC pattern and its success/failure status.

histogram.name: Arc.DeferActivation.{DeferArcActivationType}{SuccessFailure}.Reason
histogram.summary: The reason why the activation is allowed for each group of deferring ARC pattern and its success/failure status.

histogram.name: Arc.EngagementTime.ArcTotal
histogram.summary: Total of Arc.EngagementTime.Background and Arc.EngagementTime.Foreground. Note that this differs from Arc.EngagementTime.Total in that this is the ARC++ engagement time, while Arc.EngagementTime.Total is the CrOS total engagement time on devices with ARC++ enabled. See Arc.EngagementTime.Total for definition of engagement and further details.

histogram.name: Arc.EngagementTime.Background
histogram.summary: Times when user is engaged and ARC++ apps are running in the background, but the user isn't focusing on an ARC++ app window. See Arc.EngagementTime.Total for definition of engagement and details.

histogram.name: Arc.EngagementTime.Foreground
histogram.summary: Times when user is engaged and focuses on an ARC++ app window. See Arc.EngagementTime.Total for definition of engagement and details.

histogram.name: Arc.EngagementTime.Total
histogram.summary: Total CrOS user session time (from login to logout) excluding times when user "disengages": screen is locked or dims down due to user idle. Engagement time metrics, along with foreground and background time, are only collected on users with ARC++ enabled. All four metrics are accumulated and recorded to UMA once a day. For Total ARC++ engagement time, please see Arc.EngagementTime.ArcTotal.

histogram.name: Arc.FirstAppLaunchDelay.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the when user requests app launch before ARC boot and ARC is booted. Note, ARC booted does not mean app is actually shown. You may consider Arc.FirstAppLaunchDelay.TimeDeltaUntilAppLaunch also. Unlike Arc.FirstAppLaunchDelay.TimeDeltaUntilAppLaunch, this metric is recorded only up to once a user session. Zero when the container has already been up and running when the user launches the ARC app.

histogram.name: Arc.FirstAppLaunchDelay.TimeDeltaUntilAppLaunch
histogram.summary: How long the user sees the spinning icon waiting for ARC boot. This metric is not recorded at all if the user launches apps only after ARC is booted. Unlike Arc.FirstAppLaunchDelay.TimeDelta, this metric might be recorded multiple times per a user session, for example when users starts multiple ARC apps while ARC is booting.

histogram.name: Arc.FirstAppLaunchRequest.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the when UI is shown after login to when the user activates first ARC app.

histogram.name: Arc.GameControls.ButtonOptionsMenuFunctionTriggered
histogram.summary: Records how often a specific function within the game controls button options menu is triggered.

histogram.name: Arc.GameControls.EditDeleteMenuFuctionTriggered
histogram.summary: Records how often a specific function within the game controls edit/delete menu is triggered.

histogram.name: Arc.GameControls.EditingListFunctionTriggered
histogram.summary: Records how often a specific function within the game controls editing list is triggered.

histogram.name: Arc.GameControls.{FeatureOrHint}ToggleWithMappingSource.{OnOrOff}
histogram.summary: Records the game controls feature or hint is toggled on or off with current mapping source.

histogram.name: Arc.GhostWindowViewType
histogram.summary: Number of the view type of ARC app ghost window. Counted when the ghost window created or the view updated.

histogram.name: Arc.GuestZram.ReclaimedProcess
histogram.summary: Number of reclaimed process. Counted when there is a successful guest zram reclaim.

histogram.name: Arc.GuestZram.SuccessfulReclaim
histogram.summary: Outcome of an ARC Guest Zram reclaim operation. True if at least one process was successfully reclaimed, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Arc.GuestZram.TotalReclaimTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time to reclaim memory from all processs. Recorded only when there is a successful guest zram reclaim.

histogram.name: Arc.GuestZram.UnreclaimedProcess
histogram.summary: Number of unreclaimed process. Counted when there is a successful guest zram reclaim.

histogram.name: Arc.IconLoadFromFileTime.compressedFirst5
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of first 5 compressed app icons is loaded from file system. Recorded when the app icon loading completes.

histogram.name: Arc.IconLoadFromFileTime.compressedOthers
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of other compressed app icons is loaded from file system. Recorded when the app icon loading completes.

histogram.name: Arc.IconLoadFromFileTime.uncompressedFirst5
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of first 5 uncompressed app icons is loaded from file system. Recorded when the app icon loading completes.

histogram.name: Arc.IconLoadFromFileTime.uncompressedOthers
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of other uncompressed app icons is loaded from file system. Recorded when the app icon loading completes.

histogram.name: Arc.IdleManager.ScreenOffTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time spent in screen-off mode, induced by inactivity detected in ARCVM. Recorded each time we wake up from that mode, and also when there's a loss of connection with ARCVM (logout or crash) while in screen-off mode.

histogram.name: Arc.InputOverlay.ActionRepositionOperationType
histogram.summary: Records the Action reposition operation types, including touchscreen drag, mouse drag and keyboard arrow keys, when users move action views to adjust touch points. Records the events when users release touch, mouse or key.

histogram.name: Arc.InputOverlay.ButtonGroupRepositionOperationType
histogram.summary: Records the button group reposition operation types, including touchscreen drag, mouse drag and keyboard arrow keys, when users move the button group. Records the events when users release touch, mouse or key.

histogram.name: Arc.InputOverlay.Customized
histogram.summary: Count the usage of input overlay editing feature on all associated apps. The metric is recorded when users press the Customize button. Refer to InputMenuView::OnButtonCustomizedPressed().

histogram.name: Arc.InputOverlay.FeatureState
histogram.summary: Check whether users play the game with input overlay feature enabled or disabled on all associated apps. The metric is recorded when users launch the associated apps and when users have menu state changed upon on closing the input menu only. Refer to TouchInjector::RecordMenuStateOnLaunch() and TouchInjector::OnInputMenuViewRemoved().

histogram.name: Arc.InputOverlay.MappingHintState
histogram.summary: Check whether users play the game with input overlay mapping hint enabled or disabled on all associated apps. The metric is recorded when users launch the associated apps and when users have menu state changed upon on closing the input menu only. Refer to TouchInjector::RecordMenuStateOnLaunch() and TouchInjector::OnInputMenuViewRemoved().

histogram.name: Arc.InputOverlay.MenuEntryRepositionOperationType
histogram.summary: Records the menu entry button reposition operation types, including touchscreen drag, mouse drag and keyboard arrow keys, when users move menu entry button. Records the events when users release touch, mouse or key.

histogram.name: Arc.InputOverlay.{UI}RepositionWindowStateType
histogram.summary: Records the window state type when {UI} reposition happens. Records the events when users release touch, mouse or key.

histogram.name: Arc.KeyMint.KeyMintError
histogram.summary: Emitted for errors on KeyMint calls. Coverage includes some error types and only on certain KeyMint calls.

histogram.name: Arc.KeyMint.KeyMintError.{ArcKeyMintLoggedOperation}
histogram.summary: Emits the error for each {ArcKeyMintLoggedOperation} call in ARC KeyMint.

histogram.name: Arc.LaunchedWithGhostWindow
histogram.summary: The number of ARC apps launched with ghost window.

histogram.name: Arc.LoadAverageX100PerProcessor15MinutesAfterArcStart.{ArcBootType}
histogram.summary: The 15-minute load average multiplied by 100 and divided by the number of logical processors online. Recorded 15 minutes after ARC start.

histogram.name: Arc.LoadAverageX100PerProcessor1MinuteAfterArcStart.{ArcBootType}
histogram.summary: The 1-minute load average multiplied by 100 and divided by the number of logical processors online. Recorded 1 minute after ARC start.

histogram.name: Arc.LoadAverageX100PerProcessor5MinutesAfterArcStart.{ArcBootType}
histogram.summary: The 5-minute load average multiplied by 100 and divided by the number of logical processors online. Recorded 5 minutes after ARC start.

histogram.name: Arc.NativeBridge
histogram.summary: Native bridge used for ARC. Can be unknown and none. This is collected along with Arc.State during every metrics recording interval, so it is in every record uploaded to the server (despite crbug.com/929583 which was fixed in M73). This is required because this value is used to categorize all other data in the dashboard as collected with specific native bridge in use. Since M74 this is also included in initial stability logs.

histogram.name: Arc.NearbyShare.ArcBridgeFailure
histogram.summary: Records any ARC Bridge connection / communication failures using NearbyShare.

histogram.name: Arc.NearbyShare.DataHandlingFailure
histogram.summary: Records any data handling errors with sharing text or files using NearbyShare.

histogram.name: Arc.NearbyShare.FileStreamComplete.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: Time taken by ARC Nearby Share to transfer file streams from ARC's virtual file system in ContentProviders to Chrome's native file system. The time is only recorded when file stream completes successfully.

histogram.name: Arc.NearbyShare.FileStreamFailure
histogram.summary: Records the reason for failing to stream a file using NearbyShare. ARC NearbyShare shares a file after finding a window, and once "share" is clicked, it attempts to send the file.

histogram.name: Arc.NearbyShare.IOFailure
histogram.summary: Records any IO errors while using NearbyShare.

histogram.name: Arc.NearbyShare.WindowFound
histogram.summary: Records the success or failure of attempts to find NearbyShare window. ARC NearbyShare finds a window after the "nearby share" button is clicked in an app. If NearbyShare successfully finds a window, "true" is recorded onto the histogram. "false" is recorded in the case a window is not found.

histogram.name: Arc.Net.ArcNetworkError
histogram.summary: Records errors that happened inside the ARC networking and WiFi Java stack.

histogram.name: Arc.Net.ArcNetworkEvent
histogram.summary: Records events triggered inside ARC networking and WiFi Java stack related to Android API usage by Android Apps, mojom API usage by the host, and other events such as VPN connections

histogram.name: Arc.Net.DnsQuery.AndroidApi
histogram.summary: Records the success result of DNS query resolution inside ARC.

histogram.name: Arc.Net.DnsQuery.Other
histogram.summary: Records the success result of DNS query resolution inside ARC.

histogram.name: Arc.Net.Qos.NewQosSocketCount
histogram.summary: Records the count of newly opened QoS socket connections in a single poll every time socket connections information is polled regularly in ARC.

histogram.name: Arc.Net.Qos.QosSocketPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of QoS socket connections in a single poll every time socket connections information is polled regularly in ARC.

histogram.name: Arc.Notifications.ActionEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether at least one action button is enabled or not for an Arc notification when the notification is created.

histogram.name: Arc.Notifications.InlineReplyEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether inline reply is enabled or not for an Arc notification when the notification is created.

histogram.name: Arc.Notifications.IsCustomNotification
histogram.summary: Records whether an Arc notification is custom notification or not.

histogram.name: Arc.Notifications.Style
histogram.summary: Records the style of an Arc notification when it's created.

histogram.name: Arc.NotificationView.{ChildView}.{FadeType}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade animation of {ChildView} inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade in/out animation is completed.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInAction
histogram.summary: Arc OptIn action taken by user. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-03-17 to 2022-04-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInCancel
histogram.summary: Arc OptIn cancelation reason.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInResult
histogram.summary: Arc OptIn flow result.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInSilentAuthCode
histogram.summary: Arc Silent Auth Code status. This status is set during the ARC OptIn flow.

histogram.name: Arc.Policy.SecondaryAccountAllowedInArc.TimeDelta

histogram.name: Arc.Policy.SecondaryAccountAllowedInArc.Value
histogram.summary: Records the value of SecondaryAccountAllowedInArc policy. This is recorded when a user account is added as a secondary account (in-session). Only recorded on successful policy fetch.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.DeviceAffiliationAction

histogram.name: Arc.Runtime.Performance.Generic.Jankiness

Arc.State
histogram.summary: Whether ARC is enabled or not. Before M56 this was collected only on login and when ARC was enabled or disabled. From M56 forward this is collected during every metrics recording interval, so it is in every record uploaded to the server (despite crbug.com/929583 which was fixed in M73). This is required because this value is used to categorize all other data in the dashboard as collected with ARC enabled or not. This is true even for users who are running on ecryptfs and skipped Ext4 migration; even though ARC Apps do not run until migration is complete on N or later systems. Since M74 this is also included in initial stability logs.

histogram.summary: Counts user interactions with ARC by type, such as ARC app launches via the shelf or launcher.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.AccessDeniedAtOpenSourceFileFailureType
histogram.summary: The detailed cause of an access denied error at opening a source file during ARCVM /data migration. Reported each time when the migrator encounters such an error.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.AutoResumeCount
histogram.summary: The number of times ARCVM /data migration has been automatically resumed. This is reported when an auto-resume is triggered, or the maximum number of auto-resumes has been hit for the first time. The value 0 means that no auto-resume has been attempted, and the first auto-resume will be triggered right after the event. Samples in the overflow bucket means that the maximum number of auto-resumes has been reached but the migration is not finished yet, in which case auto-resume is disabled and the user needs to manually resume the migration. Each value should be recorded at most once per user.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.BatteryConsumption
histogram.summary: The amount of decrease in battery level during ARCVM /data migration, defined by the battery level at the beginning of the migration minus the lowest battery level observed during the migration. Reported at the end of successful migrations. 0 is reported if the battery level has always been higher than that at the beginning of the migration.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.DesiredDiskImageSizeInGB.{SatisfiedOrNot}
histogram.summary: The desired disk image size for the destination of ARCVM /data migration. Reported each time the initial screen is shown and the free disk space requirement is {SatisfiedOrNot}.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration of the ARCVM /data migration. This is reported once when a newly started migration is completed.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.EndStatus
histogram.summary: The status of ARCVM /data migration when it ends. This is reported when a migration finishes successfully, fails, or gets cancelled halfway.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.FailedErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a file operation failure that caused the ARCVM /data migration to fail. Reported when a migration thread encounters a file operation error. This can be reported multiple times for a migration when multiple threads fail at around the same time.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.FailedOperationType
histogram.summary: The type of file operation at which the ARCVM /data migration failed. Reported when a migration thread encounters a file operation error. This can be reported multiple times for a migration when multiple threads fail at around the same time.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.FailedPathType
histogram.summary: The location of files at which ARCVM /data migration failed. Reported when a migration thread encounters a file operation error. This can be reported multiple times for a migration when multiple threads fail at around the same time.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.GetAndroidDataInfoDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken for ArcVmDataMigrator's D-Bus method GetAndroidDataInfo to return a result, measured from the caller (Chrome) side. Reported every time the migration welcome screen is being set up.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.InitialBatteryLevel
histogram.summary: The battery level when the user enters the UX flow of ARCVM /data migration. This is reported for both new migrations and resumed migrations.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.InitialFreeSpace
histogram.summary: The total amount of free disk space on the system when a new or resumed ARCVM /data migration is started. Reported when a migration failed with ENOSPC (no space error).

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.MigrationFinishReason{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: The reason why ARCVM /data migration is marked as finished. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.MigrationStatusOnArcStarted{ArcUserTypes}
histogram.summary: The status of ARCVM /data migration at the beginning of each ARC session. {ArcUserTypes}

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.NoSpaceFailureFreeSpace
histogram.summary: The total amount of free disk space on the system when the user encounters ENOSPC (no space error) during ARCVM /data migration. Reported when a migration failed with ENOSPC.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.NoSpaceXattrSize
histogram.summary: The total number of bytes of xattr data that we are trying to store on a file when we encounter an ENOSPC (no space error) during ARCVM /data migration. This includes both the xattr data already present on the file as well as the new xattr we are trying to set. Reported when a migration thread encounters ENOSPC on setting a new xattr. This can be reported multiple times for a migration when multiple threads fail at around the same time.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.NotificationShownForTheFirstTime
histogram.summary: Counts the number of events that the notification for ARCVM /data migration is shown for the first first time for the user.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.RemainingDays.{ArcVmDataMigrationFrontEndEvents}
histogram.summary: The number of days until the deadline displayed in the notification or the confirmation dialog of ARCVM /data migration. The value is initialized as 30 when the notification is shown for the first time, and decremented until it reaches the minimum value 1. When it reaches the minimum value, it means that the migration should be performed in the same day and should not be dismissed, so the notification and the dialog become nondismissible. Reported when {ArcVmDataMigrationFrontEndEvents}.

variant.name: ConfirmationDialogAccepted
variant.summary: the accept button of the confirmation dialog is clicked

variant.name: ConfirmationDialogCanceled
variant.summary: the cancel button of the confirmation dialog is clicked

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.RequiredFreeDiskSpaceInGB.{SatisfiedOrNot}
histogram.summary: The size of free disk space required for the ARCVM /data migration. Reported each time the initial screen is shown and the free disk space requirement is {SatisfiedOrNot}.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.ResumeNotificationShown
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the notification for resuming ARCVM /data migration is shown while the migration is in progress. The notification is shown (and thus the event is reported) only when auto-resume is disabled after the maximum number of auto-resumes has been reached but the migration has not finished yet.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.ScreenEvent.On{ArcVmDataMigrationType}
histogram.summary: Records events happening in the screen flow of ARCVM /data migration. Recorded when an event happens during a {ArcVmDataMigrationType}.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.ScreenInitialState.On{ArcVmDataMigrationType}
histogram.summary: The initial state of the screen flow of ARCVM /data migration. Recorded at the beginning of each {ArcVmDataMigrationType}.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.ScreenSetupFailure.On{ArcVmDataMigrationType}
histogram.summary: Records failures in the setup phase of the screen flow of ARCVM /data migration. Recorded when a failure happens during a {ArcVmDataMigrationType}.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.SetupResult
histogram.summary: The result of the setup of ARCVM /data migration. Reported before triggering the migration tool.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.StartStatus
histogram.summary: The status of ARCVM /data migration when it starts. This is reported when a new migration or a resumed migration is started.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.TotalFiles
histogram.summary: Total number of files to be migrated in ARCVM /data migration. Reported once at the beginning of a new migration.

histogram.name: Arc.VmDataMigration.TotalSizeMB
histogram.summary: Total bytes to be migrated in ARCVM /data migration. Reported once at the beginning of a new migration.

histogram.name: Arc.VmmSwappedOut
histogram.summary: Records the ARCVM vmm swap status (ARCVM not swapped / ARCVM has been vmm swapped). "vmm swap" means a part of the ARCVM memory lives in ChromeOS side disk and will be automatically swap back when vCPU access it. The recorded "Swapped Out" state means the ARCVM is in the swapped out state at the end of the recording interval. Collected during every metrics recording interval if ARCVM is running. Caveat: The metric will be logged in every UMA record, except the data about the previous session.

histogram.name: Arc.VmRemovableMediaUnmount.Duration
histogram.summary: The time taken for ARCVM to drop any references to a removable media before unmounting it on the host side. Not recorded for ARC++ container.

histogram.name: Arc.VmRemovableMediaUnmount.Result
histogram.summary: The result of the attempt to drop ARCVM-side references to a removable media before unmounting it on the host side. Not recorded for ARC++ container.

histogram.name: Arc.VpnServiceBuilderCompatApisCounter
histogram.summary: Records the number of times an API for adding and excluding route in VPN is called from ChromeOS Vpn Service Builder Compat Library.

histogram.name: Arc.Wakeup.{DeviceType}
histogram.summary: Every time a {DeviceType} device wakes ARCVM up from a sleep state (e.g. s2idle), records how long ARCVM was in that sleep state before being woken up.

histogram.name: Arc.WallpaperApiUsage
histogram.summary: Records the number of times an API for getting / setting wallpaper from Android is called.

histogram.name: Arc.Wayland.LateTiming.Duration{WaylandEventType}
histogram.summary: The duration of the Wayland client event processing time in ARC. This metric is recorded when the processing end time is late or the duration exceeded the expected timing threshold for a {WaylandEventType}.

histogram.name: Arc.Wayland.LateTiming.Event
histogram.summary: Wayland client event message type in ARC. This metric is recorded when the message processing end time is late or the duration exceeded the expected timing threshold.

histogram.name: Arc.WindowPredictorLaunch
histogram.summary: Number of ARC app ghost window launches by ArcWindowPredictor. Counted when user manually launches ARC app when ARC is still in boot stage.

histogram.name: Arc.WindowPredictorUseCase
histogram.summary: Records the number of each use case of window predictor. Recorded when the window perdictor called to launch ARC ghost window intentionally.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.AppErrorDialog.Type
histogram.summary: Records the number of each AppErrorDialogType when an app error dialog is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.WindowClosedDelayTimeV2.ArcApp
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from a window closing operation until the window is destroyed. The data is collected once when a closing operation happens.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.WindowDragResizeTime
histogram.summary: Records the time of handling each bounds changing request of drag resizing operation. The data is collected when ARC window drag resizing operation happens. Note that this metric might be recorded multiple times for a single drag operation if multiple bounds changing requests occur in one drag operation.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.WindowEnterTabletModeDelayTimeV2.{ChromeOSAppType}
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from entering the tablet mode until the window state is changed to be maximized in tablet mode. The data is only collected for the top window shown in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.WindowExitTabletModeDelayTimeV2.{ChromeOSAppType}
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from exiting the tablet mode until the window state is changed to be normal in clamshell mode. The data is only collected for the top window shown in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.WindowMaximizedDelayTimeV2.{ChromeOSAppType}
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from a window maximizing operation until the window state is changed to be maximized. The data is collected once when a maximizing operation happens.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.WindowMinimizedDelayTime.{ChromeOSAppType}
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from window minimizing operation until the window state is changed to be minimized. The data is collected once when a minimizing operation happens.

histogram.name: Arc.WM.WindowRotateDelayTime.{ChromeOSAppType}
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from display rotates in tablet mode until the window bounds is changed. The data is only collected for the top maximized window shown in tablet mode.
